conclusion: Analyze the forces acting on block A and block B.
Block A is on an inclined plane with an angle of 30Â°.
Forces on block A: gravitational force, normal force, tension in the rope.
Component of gravitational force along the incline is \( mg \sin(30^\circ) \).
Forces on block B: gravitational force, tension in the rope.
For block A to remain stationary, \( T = mg \sin(30^\circ) \).
For block B to remain stationary, \( T = m_B g \).
Solve for mass of block B: \( m_B = \frac{m}{2} \).
Final answer: The mass of block B is \(\frac{m}{2}\).
